metadata.title: B2 Gap-Fill Set 04 - Grammar Focus Practice
metadata.description: Targeted practice for specific grammar patterns. Each category contains 15-20 sentences focusing on one grammatical structure.
metadata.usage: Select a category to practice specific weaknesses identified from test results

categories.name: Verb + Preposition
categories.description: Common verb-preposition combinations (movement, communication, thinking verbs)

sentences.q: The navigation instinct makes certain creatures return _____ the place they consider home.
They identify the place _____ home.
Its owners had transported it _____ their new residence.
The animal appeared _____ its previous home.
Chester completed a trek back _____ its earlier residence.
Bees are important _____ us not just because they make honey.
They play an important part _____ agricultural production.
The flowers provide them _____ food.
They asked a local inhabitant what it was called. In reply, the man said 'kangaroo', which translates _____ English as 'I don't understand'.
Human beings have used them to carry messages back home. However, cat owners tend _____ find the homing instinct simply irritating.
We're encouraging students _____ create unique Irish dishes.
His parents took me _____ see a science fiction film.
They asked a local inhabitant _____ it was called.
Getting them _____ do this takes a huge amount of training.
Two days after his birthday, Dickens was made _____ work in a factory.
British Airways prepares this food _____ its home airport.
It had been advertised _____ the greatest film about space exploration.
Many passengers who book seats fail _____ turn up.
Charles Dickens described his experiences _____ his novel 'Oliver Twist'.
He suffered _____ a child worker in Victorian England.
Only human beings are capable _____ doing this.
It proved remarkably powerful _____ a European dog called Atlas.
The kangaroo is an instantly recognisable animal whose familiar outline is often used _____ a symbol of Australia.
Their smaller relations are more usually known _____ wallabies.
Every square centimetre of space is _____ great demand.
Japanese cyclists need to be capable _____ storing their cycles in tiny areas.
The basic idea is _____ original, but its inventor has created an especially clever variation.
I found it necessary _____ work hard to build up a reputation.
It is possible _____ fold it up quickly.
The bodies of bees are quite fragile and, _____ a result, they are easily damaged.
Bees are very important _____ agriculture because many plants can only be fertilised by them.
Charles was not extremely unhappy, but also ashamed _____ working there.
According _____ legend, the animal was given the name as the result of a misunderstanding.
Countries which have a reputation _____ excellent food.
It is feasible _____ collapse it up quickly once folded.

categories.name: Linking Words - Time
categories.description: Connectors showing time relationships: after, before, when, while, as soon as

sentences.q: The cat disappeared shortly _____ its owners had taken it to their new home.
_____ the first European explorers saw the strange hopping creature, they asked a local inhabitant what it was called.
I still get tears in my eyes _____ I remember this scene.
_____ animals make a sound, such as a bark or a call, it is in reaction to what is happening.
_____ it lands on a flower, a bee picks up several substances including a yellow powder called 'pollen'.
_____ they are carrying pollen, bees accidentally drop some of it onto other flowers.
_____ the crew of the spaceship went on dangerous walks in space, it was even more impressive.
Two days _____ his twelfth birthday, Dickens was taken away from school.
About four hours _____ departure time, the centre begins to fill up the trays.
His own wife and children knew little about his childhood _____ Dickens was still alive.
_____ we left the cinema, my parents looked puzzled.
Pigeons have the homing instinct and, over _____ centuries, humans have used them to carry messages.
_____ I was nine years old, my parents took me to see a science fiction film.
Humans have utilized them to carry communications back home, and, _____ ancient times, they have been invaluable.
Recently, folding bicycles have become very popular - _____ the last decade, sales have tripled.

categories.name: Linking Words - Contrast
categories.description: Connectors showing contrast or concession: although, though, even though, while, whereas

sentences.q: The cat appeared at its previous home even _____ this was 1,360 kilometres away.
I couldn't really understand the story. I thoroughly enjoyed the film _____ it wasn't a problem for me.
_____ the basic idea is not original, its inventor has created an especially clever variation.
_____ the word kangaroo comes from an ancient Australian language, it is not the word speakers of that language used to describe the animal.
Bees spend a lot of time looking for flowers. _____ they do not eat, they will die in twenty-four hours.
Charles was not extremely unhappy, _____ also ashamed of working there.
Other cats may not travel so far _____ many keep on going back to their old home.
I've made every mistake that it's possible to make, _____ because of this, I know what people do wrong.
Soon you will have dozens of good ideas, _____ these are not terribly original.
At first the blank screen might appear to offer very little _____ some say it eventually works out.
Pilsbury made the journey 40 times despite _____ to cross several busy roads.
The spaceships looked so very real that I couldn't believe that they were not, in fact, real - _____ I was only nine years old.
_____ flights may appear fully-booked, chefs will produce meals according to predictions.
The school was by no means an overnight success - _____, I found it necessary to work hard.
'Now though, things are changing,' says Kathleen - showing contrast _____ past practices.

categories.name: Linking Words - Cause & Result
categories.description: Connectors showing cause and effect: because, since, as, so that, as a result

sentences.q: I've made every mistake that it's possible to make, but _____ of this, I know what people do wrong.
Bees are very important for agriculture _____ many plants can only be fertilised by the activity of bees.
This is _____ so many passengers who book seats fail to turn up.
We get excellent produce from Irish farms and, _____ a result, we're encouraging students to create unique Irish dishes.
The bodies of bees are quite fragile and, as a _____, they are easily damaged by strong winds.
This bike is designed _____ that it is possible to fold it up quickly.
The spaceships looked _____ very real that I couldn't believe they were not, in fact, real.
Working in the factory affected him so deeply _____ he found it too painful to speak about in later life.
According to legend, the animal was given the name _____ the result of a misunderstanding.
Cat owners have to keep returning to their old address in _____ to bring their cat home.
Some animals have even managed to put signs together in _____ to make simple sentences.
I found it necessary to work hard _____ build up a reputation.
Humans have utilized them _____ carry communications back home.
A number of schools have been set up in Ireland _____ promote Irish cooking.
Students are encouraged to create unique dishes _____ reflect our heritage.

categories.name: Relative Pronouns
categories.description: Who, which, whose, where, what in defining and non-defining clauses

sentences.q: Cat owners, _____ have to keep returning to their old address, tend to find the homing instinct irritating.
The kangaroo is an animal _____ familiar outline is often used as a symbol of Australia.
Tokyo is a city _____ every square centimetre of space is in great demand.
It is in reaction to _____ is happening around them.
Most authors admit that the brilliant idea, _____ seems to arrive from nowhere, does not often come along.
To write short stories you must read _____ is currently being published.
I clearly remember the way in _____ the giant space station seemed to roll over my head.
There was one of the most beautiful things _____ I'd ever seen.
They are never found very far from the flowers _____ provide them with food.
The movements tell other bees _____ far they have to fly.
Its catering centre has chefs who prepare meals for flights _____ could feed almost fifty-six thousand people.
Kathleen initially copied the classical dishes of countries _____ have a reputation for excellent food.
Oliver Twist was one of his most famous characters and he too suffered as a child worker, _____ was common in that era.
All of _____ belong to the kangaroo family and have a similar appearance.
They asked a local inhabitant _____ it was called.
When we left the cinema, my parents had not understood _____ the film was about.
We're encouraging students to create unique Irish dishes _____ reflect our heritage.
In reply, the man said 'kangaroo', _____ translates into English as 'I don't understand'.

categories.name: Phrasal Verbs
categories.description: Common multi-word verbs: set up, turn up, work out, fill up

sentences.q: A number of cookery schools have been set _____ in Ireland.
Many passengers who book seats fail to turn _____.
At first the blank screen might appear to offer very little but some say it eventually works _____.
About four hours before departure time, the centre begins to fill _____ the trays.
The cat turned _____ at its old home a year later.
Other cats may not travel so far but many keep _____ going back.
Once folded, you pull the bike _____ with ease.
I found it necessary to work hard to build _____ a reputation.
Others prefer to go jogging and often return home having successfully dreamed _____ a good storyline.
Students must read what is currently being published to find _____ what readers want.
The crew of the spaceship went _____ dangerous walks in space.
Bees accidentally drop some pollen _____ other flowers.
These meals can be ordered _____ to twenty-four hours before departure.
His parents did their best to look _____ him.
Dickens was taken _____ from school by his parents.
Over _____ centuries, humans have used pigeons to carry messages.
Animal species have developed ways of communicating with _____ another.
_____ such school is run by Kathleen Doyle.
_____ method is to read other people's work.
My parents took me to see _____ a science fiction film.
I thought it was _____ of the most beautiful things I'd ever seen.
They move around with a long tail to keep _____ balance.
The word kangaroo is used for any _____ about forty-seven different species.
Bees spend a _____ of time looking for flowers.
Getting them to do this takes a huge _____ of training.
At _____ the blank screen might appear to offer very little.
The blank screen might appear to offer very _____ in the way of a good idea.
Passengers are given at _____ one hot meal.
Folding bicycles have been around for quite _____ time now.
I've made _____ mistake that it's possible to make.
Wild kangaroos are still found in almost _____ part of Australia.
At the time of _____ death in 1870, Dickens was a wealthy man.
Factories could be dangerous places in _____ days.

categories.name: Comparisons & Intensifiers
categories.description: Comparative structures: as...as, like, such, so, very, too

sentences.q: A jumbo jet holds as many people _____ a medium-sized hotel.
When animals make a sound, such _____ a bark or a call.
This may sound _____ a statement of the obvious.
Just _____ most cookery schools in Ireland, Kathleen initially copied classical dishes.
The spaceships looked _____ very real that I couldn't believe they weren't real.
My parents took me to see such _____ science fiction film.
This bike is designed _____ that it is possible to fold it up quickly.
British Airways, in _____ with most major airlines, prepares food at its home airport.
Working in the factory affected him so deeply _____ he found it too painful to speak about.
Once folded, you pull the bike along with _____.
The school was by no _____ an overnight success.
They can reach speeds of up to 60 kph and jump over obstacles three metres _____.
It is designed in such _____ way that it is possible to fold it quickly.
Was one of the most beautiful things I'd _____ seen.
Kathleen Doyle runs a school not _____ from the centre of Dublin.

categories.name: Auxiliary Verbs & Modals
categories.description: Be, have, do as auxiliaries; modals: can, may, should, must, would

sentences.q: Folding bicycles have _____ around for quite some time.
An amazing new Japanese version _____ be folded with swiftness.
It _____ sometimes said that animals use language.
Chimpanzees have _____ taught to use their hands.
It had _____ advertised everywhere as the greatest film.
Wild kangaroos _____ still to be found in quite large numbers.
Recently, folding bicycles _____ become very popular in Japan.
His parents _____ their best to look after him.
Eventually, his father _____ a large amount of money.
Charles _____ never forgot that period of his life.
Dickens' novels showed how shocking conditions _____.
A student on my course _____ never actually read any short stories.
Flights may appear fully-booked; chefs will produce meals according to predictions of how many seats will actually be _____.
I couldn't believe _____ they were not real.
When a bee discovers a new source, it can inform other bees by _____ a special dance.
These meals can be _____ up to twenty-four hours before departure.

categories.name: Gerunds & Infinitives
categories.description: Verb patterns with -ing forms and to-infinitives

sentences.q: Other cats may not travel so far but many keep _____ going back.
Pilsbury made the journey 40 times in spite _____ having to cross several busy roads.
Cat owners tend _____ find the homing instinct irritating.
It is possible _____ fold it up quickly.
Only human beings are capable _____ doing this.
Getting them _____ do this takes a huge amount of training.
Others prefer to go jogging and often return home _____ successfully dreamed up a good storyline.
Animals cannot make a call _____ 'I was scared yesterday.'
I found it necessary _____ work hard to build up a reputation.
We're encouraging students _____ create unique Irish dishes.
To write short stories you must read _____ is currently being published.
His parents took me _____ see a science fiction film.
When it lands on a flower, a bee picks up several substances _____ a yellow powder.
Bees spend a lot of time looking for flowers that contain pollen.
When a bee discovers a new source, it can inform other bees by _____ a special dance.
Two days after his twelfth birthday, Dickens was made _____ work in a factory.
Charles was ashamed _____ working there.

categories.name: Fixed Expressions & Collocations
categories.description: Common fixed phrases and word partnerships

sentences.q: Cat owners have to keep returning in _____ to bring their cat home.
The bodies of bees are fragile and, as a _____, they are easily damaged.
Once folded, you pull the bike along with _____.
The school was by no _____ an overnight success.
But many of them do not read very much at _____.
When they are carrying pollen, bees drop some of it and in this _____ they fertilise flowers.
British Airways, in _____ with most major airlines, prepares food at its home airport.
The chefs plan quantities based _____ information from the computer.
Passengers are given at _____ one hot meal, plus snacks.
His parents did _____ best to look after him.
For the first _____, the explorers saw the strange hopping creature.
According _____ legend, the animal was given the name as the result of a misunderstanding.
At _____ the blank screen might appear to offer very little.
The brilliant idea seems to arrive from _____.
I clearly remember the way in _____ the space station seemed to roll.
I still get tears in my eyes _____ I remember this scene.
There was one of the most beautiful things _____ I'd ever seen.
The crew went _____ dangerous walks in space.
They play an important part _____ agricultural production.
Instead _____ preparing the hot dishes between airlines, some pre-cook the food.
